After installing 3.1, I noticed that I was getting an "unbound" message next to
the JRE system lib in my project.  I tried to go to the "Installed JRE's" tab in
the Preferenes, but it gave me a "Cound Not Accept Changes: the 
currently displayed page contains invalid values" window.  Clicking back and
forth a bit would eventually get me to the window, but the error log for the

So needless to say with these errors I didn't get a chance to see if the Debug
error was or wasn't occuring with the 3.1 build.  I kept my old version around
so I'm going to keep working on that.  I hope this helps.
Mike

See the 3.1 porting guide. I think the plug-
in "com.nokia.phone.tools.sdk.plugin.eclipse" will need to adopt the API 
change. 

9. API contract changes to IVMInstall
What is affected: Plug-ins that implement org.eclipse.jdt.launching.IVMInstall.

Description: In Eclipse 3.0, the class org.eclipse.jdt.launching.IVMInstall 
was not marked that clients may not implement directly. This was an oversight 
that has been addressed in Eclipse 3.1 with the class marked as not intended 
to be implemented directly by clients. Three new methods have been added to 
this interface with default implementations provided by 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMInstall.

Action required: Any implementing classes that do not already subclass 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMInstall will need to be reworked to 
subclass org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMInstall.

Will invesitgate a fix for RC3. Plan is to proxy VM installs that do not 
adhere to the 3.1 contract with default implementations of the new methods.

Still open for investigation, but not committed to RC3. The proxy plan did not 
work out, as the "vm type" is responsible for storing the VMs, and does not 
know about the proxies (and stores the original VMs, that clients may access).

Created an attachment (id=23493)
Zip of patches for 4 affected plug-ins

Patches for:

org.eclipse.jdt.launching
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests
org.eclipse.jdt.ui

The above patch experiments with separating the new methods into a separate, 
optional interface, IVMInstall2, that an IVMInstall may implement.

Will fix for RC4, as discussed at Eclipse "end game" call, to avoid breaking 
API changes. Patch needs to be enhanced to include better documentation.

CC'ing Dirk, as this requires small changes in JUI.

Asking Dirk and Darin (S) for offical component owner votes. CC'ing Jim for 
PMC approval for API change.
